attributes.text: A dialog with a form that is constructed on-the-fly
The form data map
The old value
Constructs the form on-the-fly

Create OK Button unlike our superclass, we do not add an appear listener to focus OK cherry-picked from from https://github.com/derrell/qx-contrib-Dialog/commit/c656f1cb98cbd1e61456566b63b5a4926dfe9cef
Create the main content of the widget
Handle click on ok button. Calls callback with the result map
The form to bind

Hook for subclasses to do something with the form, for example in order to attach bindings to the validation manager. Default behavior: bind the enabled state of the “OK” button to the validity of the current form.
Return the form

Returns the (computed) value of the property formData.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #formData}.
(Computed) value of formData.

Returns the (computed) value of the property labelColumnWidth.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #labelColumnWidth}.
(Computed) value of labelColumnWidth.

Returns the (computed) value of the property model.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.
(Computed) value of model.
Initial value for property formData.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property formData with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #formData}.
the default value
Initial value for property labelColumnWidth.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property labelColumnWidth with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #labelColumnWidth}.
the default value
Initial value for property model.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property model with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.
the default value

Resets the user value of the property formData.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #formData}.

Resets the user value of the property labelColumnWidth.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #labelColumnWidth}.

Resets the user value of the property model.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.
New value for property formData.

Sets the user value of the property formData.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #formData}.
The unmodified incoming value.
New value for property labelColumnWidth.

Sets the user value of the property labelColumnWidth.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #labelColumnWidth}.
The unmodified incoming value.
New value for property model.

Sets the user value of the property model.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #model}.
The unmodified incoming value.

Data to create a form with multiple fields. So far implemented: TextField / TextArea ComboBox SelectBox RadioGroup CheckBox

{
 "username" : {
    'type'  : "TextField",
    'label' : "User Name",
    'value' : ""
  },
  "address" : {
    'type'  : "TextArea",
    'label' : "Address",
    'lines' : 3
  },
  "domain" : {
    'type'  : "SelectBox",
    'label' : "Domain",
    'value' : 1,
    'options' : [
      { 'label' : "Company", 'value' : 0 },
      { 'label' : "Home",    'value' : 1 }
    ]
  },
  "commands" : {
   'type'  : "ComboBox",
    'label' : "Shell command to execute",
    'options' : [
      { 'label' : "ln -s *" },
      { 'label' : "rm -Rf /" }
    ]
  }
}
The default width of the column with the field labels
The model of the result data
Fired on change of the property {@link #formData}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #model}.
